children.name: wear
children.definition: to have your hair or beard in a particular style or shape : cột tóc , để tóc, để râu

children.name: wear your hair long/in a ponytail etc
examples: He wore his hair in a ponytail.
She wore her hair loose.
When she's working she wears her hairina ponytail.
You should wear your hairup(= so that it does not hang down) more often - it suits you.

children.name: hairstyle
children.definition: the style in which sb’s hair has been cut or arranged :
examples: Do you like my new hairstyle?
For example there are several magazines devoted to only hairstyles and hair care.
Before going to bed last night I combed my hair into stupid hairstyles.

children.name: haircut
children.definition: the style your hair is cut in : kiểu tóc
examples: Do you like my new haircut?
How do you like my new haircut?

children.name: perm
children.definition: / permanentUS or formal  hair that has been treated in this way: tóc uốn
examples: a very curly perm

children.name: shapes that are specialized for hair
wavy
children.definition: wavy hair grows in waves
examples: Sarah's got lovely wavy blond hair.

children.name: thick
children.definition: having a lot of hair or fur :
examples: She ran her fingers through her thick brown hair.

children.name: curly
children.definition: having a lot of curls: quăn, xoăn
examples: He has blond curly hair.

children.name: frizzy
children.definition: disapproving (of hair) very curly and not smooth or shiny: quăn
examples: My hair goes all frizzy if it gets rained on.

children.name: loose
children.definition: if your hair is loose, it hangs freely rather than being tied back :
examples: Her hair fell loose around her shoulders.

children.name: hanging loose
examples: Her hair washangingloose about her shoulders.

children.name: spiky
children.definition: hair that is spiky is stiff and stands up on top of your head : vuốt nhọn lên
examples: short black spiky hair

children.name: conditions that are specialized for hair
bald
children.definition: describing or having little or no hair on your head : hói, trọc
examples: a bald man
his shiny bald head
go bald
Dad startedgoing baldwhen he was in his thirties.
At twenty he was alreadygoingbald.
bald patch
He combed his hair and tried to hide hisbald patch(= part of sb’s head where there is no hair).

children.name: dry
children.definition: describes hair that does not have enough of the natural oils that make it soft and smooth: khô
examples: a shampoo for dry hair

children.name: lank
children.definition: lank hair is not attractive because it is completely straight and thin : mỏng rũ
examples: His hair was lank and greasy and looked like it hadn't been washed for a month.

children.name: tousled
children.definition: describing or having hair that looks untidy, as if it has been rubbedrối bù; bù xù
examples: Naomi stood in front of them, her face flushed, herhairtousled.
He came to breakfast, all tousled, in last night's clothes.

children.name: beard
children.definition: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks: râu
examples: a flowing white beard.
He'sgrowinga beard.
Heshaved offhis beard but kept his moustache.

children.name: moustache
children.definition: /mustacheUS  hair which a man grows above his upper lip: ria
examples: Groucho Marx had a thick black moustache.

children.name: fringe
children.definition: UKbangsUS an area of hair hanging over the forehead that is cut shorter than the rest of the hair: tóc mái
examples: a short fringe
a tall girl with straight brown hair and a fringe

children.name: hair
children.definition: one of the long fine things like thread that grows on people’s heads and on other parts of their bodies, or similar things that grow on animals : cọng tóc, cọng lông, cọng râu
examples: The cat has left white hairs all over the sofa.
I’m starting to get a few grey hairs.
long-haired/short-haired
long-haired cats

children.name: hair
children.definition: the mass of things like fine threads that grows on your head : tóc
examples: Her hair was short and dark.
a short fat man with no hair on his head.
fair-haired/dark-haired/long-haired etc
He’s a tall fair-haired guy.
colour
blackhis long black hair
whitean old man with white hair
goldenthe beautiful girl with the long golden hair
length
type
straighta girl with long straight hair
condition

children.name: dark
examples: He’s about six feet tall, with dark hair and blue eyes.

children.name: jet blackliterary
children.definition: completely black
examples: She had shiny jet black hair, and skin as white as snow.

children.name: fair
examples: Her long fair hair fell untidily over her shoulders.

children.name: blond/blonde
children.definition: yellowish-white in colour
examples: long blonde hair and blue eyes

children.name: brown
examples: Her hair was pale brown.

children.name: chestnutliterary
children.definition: dark brown
examples: She had a fine head of chestnut hair.

children.name: sandy
children.definition: yellowish-brown
examples: He wore his long, sandy brown hair in a ponytail.

children.name: mousy
children.definition: an unattractive dull brown
examples: I have pale, mousy hair that is dull and lacks shine.

children.name: red
examples: The whole family had red hair.

children.name: gingerBritish English
children.definition: orange-brown in colour
examples: a cheeky little boy with ginger hair

children.name: auburnliterary
children.definition: orange-brown in colour
examples: He gazed at her long neck and beautiful auburn hair.

children.name: grey
examples: British English,grayAmerican English She was about 70, with grey hair.

children.name: silver
examples: Her father’s hair was starting to turn silver.

children.name: short/long
examples: I like your hair when it’s short like that. A few of the boys had long hair.

children.name: shoulder-length/medium-length
examples: He had shoulder-length reddish hair.

children.name: curly
examples: When he was young, his hair was thick and curly.

children.name: frizzy
children.definition: tightly curled
examples: She had dark frizzy hair which might have been permed.

children.name: wavy
children.definition: with loose curls
examples: Her golden wavy hair fell around her shoulders.

children.name: thick
examples: She had thick hair down to her waist.

children.name: fine
children.definition: thin
examples: Her hair is so fine, it’s difficult to style.

children.name: spiky
children.definition: stiff and standing up on top of your head
examples: Billy had black spiky hair.

children.name: in good/bad/terrible etc condition
examples: How do you keep your hair in such perfect condition?

children.name: out of condition
children.definition: no longer in good condition
examples: If your hair is out of condition, this may be because you are eating the wrong foods.

children.name: glossy/shiny
examples: She combed her hair until it was all glossy.

children.name: lustrousliterary
children.definition: very shiny and attractive
examples: her lustrous dark hair flowing on to her shoulders

children.name: dull
children.definition: not shiny
examples: a shampoo for dull hair

children.name: greasy
children.definition: containing too much oil
examples: This shampoo is ideal for greasy hair.

children.name: dry
children.definition: lacking oil
examples: a shampoo for dry hair

children.name: lankespecially literary
children.definition: thin, straight, and unattractive
examples: a scruffy young man with lank hair

children.name: thinning
children.definition: becoming thinner because you are losing your hair
examples: His dark hair was thinning on top.

children.name: receding
children.definition: gradually disappearing, so that it is high on your forehead
examples: The man was in his late thirties, and his hair was receding slightly.

children.name: dishevelledespecially literary
children.definition: very untidy
examples: His face was bright red and his hair looked dishevelled.

children.name: tousledespecially literary
children.definition: a little untidy, in a way that looks attractive
examples: his youthfully handsome face and tousled hair that hung untidily over his collar

children.name: windsweptespecially literary
children.definition: blown around by the wind
examples: Her hair was all windswept when they came off the beach.

children.name: have ... hair
examples: She has beautiful blonde hair.

children.name: wash your hair
examples: He showered and washed his hair.

children.name: do your hair
children.definition: alsofix your hairAmerican English
examples: (= arrange it in a style )She’s upstairs doing her hair.

children.name: dye your hair
children.definition: blonde/red etc
examples: (= change its colour, especially using chemicals )Craig has dyed his hair black.

children.name: cut sb’s hair
examples: My Mum always cuts my hair.

children.name: grow your hair
children.definition: long
examples: (= let it grow longer)I’m growing my hair long, but it’s taking forever.

children.name: lose your hair
children.definition: become bald
examples: He was a small, round man who was losing his hair.

children.name: run your fingers through sb’s hair
children.definition: touch someone’s hair in a loving way
examples: He ran his fingers through her smooth silky hair.

children.name: ruffle sb’s hair
children.definition: rub it in a kind friendly way
examples: He patted me on the back and ruffled my hair.

children.name: hair loss
examples: The drug can cause hair loss.

children.name: hair colour
examples: British English,hair colorAmerican English Genes control characteristics such as hair colour and eye colour.

children.name: hair dye
examples: The survey showed that 75% of women have used hair dye.

children.name: a strand/ wisp of hair
children.definition: a thin piece of hair
examples: She brushed away a strand of hair from her eyes.

children.name: a lock of hair
children.definition: a fairly thick piece of hair
examples: She tossed a stray lock of hair back off her forehead.

children.name: a mop of hair
children.definition: a large amount of thick untidy hair
examples: He had an unruly mop of brown hair.

children.name: curly
children.definition: curved in shape: cong
examples: These pigs all have curly tails.

children.name: lengths that are specialized for hair
shoulder-length
children.definition: shoulder-length hair hangs down to your shoulders: dài ngang vai
examples: She had black shoulder-length hair with a heavy fringe, and a round face with bushy eyebrows.

children.name: colours that are specialized for hair
grey
children.definition: UKgrayUS  having hair that has become grey or white, usually because of age:hoa râm

children.name: go/turn grey
examples: She was a tall thin woman who had gone grey early.
He started togo/turngrey in his mid-forties.

children.name: red
children.definition: describes hair which is an orange-brown colour :hung hung đỏ
examples: her long, red hair
his hair was red

children.name: fair
children.definition: sb who is fair, or who has fair hair, has hair that is very light in colourOPP dark:nhạt,vàng nhạt
examples: She's got fair hair and blue eyes.
My sister's dark and my brother's fair (= He has fair hair) .
He's fair-haired.

children.name: blond
children.definition: / blonde hoe vàng
examples: 1blonde hair is pale or yellow in colour
blonde hair/highlights
2a woman who is blonde has pale or yellow hair
a blonde woman/ a blond man

children.name: dark
children.definition: sb who is dark or who has dark hair has hair that is brown or black in colourOPP fair: đậm, thẫm

children.name: a tall, dark man
examples: He’s about six feet tall, with dark hair and blue eyes.

children.name: chestnut
children.definition: reddish-brown in colour :màu hạt dẻ
examples: her chestnut hair

children.name: sandy
children.definition: hair that is sandy is a yellowish-brown colour: màu cát
examples: pale eyes and receding sandy hair

children.name: mousy
children.definition: mousy hair is a dull brown colour and not special or attractive : xám xịt, xỉn
examples: I had mousy brown hair and even duller gray eyes.

children.name: ginger
children.definition: hair or fur that is ginger is bright orange-brown in colour :có màu hoe
examples: ginger[S]UKoffensive aperson who has red or orange-brown hair
[as form of address]Hey, ginger, what are you doing?

children.name: a ginger cat
examples: His nickname was Ginger because of his gingerhair.

children.name: auburn
children.definition: (of hair) reddish brown:nâu vàng
examples: auburn-haired
